message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient is exhibiting signs of Tourette syndrome, which is often associated with obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD). Excessive hand washing is a common compulsion in patients with OCD. Auditory hallucinations and cough that occurs only at night are not associated with Tourette syndrome or OCD. Poor communication skills may be present, but the most specific and likely finding associated with Tourette syndrome and OCD in this case is excessive hand washing.
